articles.title: Sports News Roundup: Soccer-Australia players back coach Arnold to continue after best World Cup; Nike cuts ties with Brooklyn Nets' Kyrie Irving and more
articles.description: Unfancied Australia won two matches for the first time at a World Cup finals before bowing out in the round of 16 against Argentina. Nike cuts ties with Brooklyn Nets' Kyrie Irving Nike Inc said on Monday it has cut ties with Kyrie Irving, a month after suspending its relationship with the Brooklyn Nets star in the aftermath of his promotion of an anti-Semitic documentary.
articles.content:
Following is a summary of current sports news briefs.
Soccer-Australia players back coach Arnold to continue after best World Cup

articles.title: Stolen jerseys of Claudio Caniggia, the one he wore to score and shove out Italy in 1990 World Cup recovered. ‘Claudio excited happy!’
articles.description: Did you know Caniggia could have played for Argentina in the 2010 world cup years after retirement? “My biggest regret”
articles.content: Remember Claudio Caniggia, the Argentine known as El Hilo del Vent (The Son of the Wind) with his golden locks tailing him as he would twist and turn his way? A good friend of Diego Maradona, he was once banned for 13 months in 1993 for taking cocain... [3090 chars]

articles.title: World Cup 2022: Socceroos young star Garang Kuol not dwelling on late chance on goal against Argentina
articles.description: Teenage star Garang Kuol is excited about his imminent move overseas but not dwelling on his missed chance late in the Socceroos World Cup clash with Argentina
articles.content:
Emerging Socceroos star Garang Kuol isn’t beating himself up over his missed late opportunity in the World Cup clash against Argentina.

articles.title: Soccer-Imperious Brazil smash Koreans 4-1 to reach quarters
articles.description: After Japan's penalty shootout loss to Croatia earlier, and Australia's loss to Argentina, it means that all three Asian Confederation teams were eliminated in the first knockout round. Having failed to score in the first half of any match so far this tournament, five-times champions Brazil corrected that with four goals before the break, to end the match as any meaningful contest early on.
articles.content:
An irrepressible, irresistible Brazil lit up the night sky on Monday with one of the performances of the World Cup to shred South Korea 4-1 and set up a quarter-final clash with Croatia.
The Brazilians brought a beach soccer swagger to the iconic Sta... [3330 chars]
